put.description: Updates a user given a specified userId. This endpoint allows you to update a username or fullName and returns the updated user object.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want to lookup. Returned from the Create User endpoint. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

username.description: The unique identifier of the user

get.description: Returns a specific user given a userId and any active workflows associated with the user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want to lookup. Returned from the Create User endpoint. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

delete.description: This endpoint deletes a user account. It is most commonly used when a user stops being a customer of your platform or in conjunction with a GDPR compliance request. Note that this endpoint only deletes the user's account â€“ not any corresponding workflow logs or other data. To remove that data as part of a compliance request, see our 'Delete User Logs' endpoint

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want to lookup. Returned from the Create User endpoint. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

post.description: Creates a new user in your Embedded account. The user record acts like a "container" to store all the integrations, workflows, and credentials for any given user. Returns a user identifier.

fullName.description: The name of the user you want to create. Typically a full name.

username.description: The username to be associated with the user.  To easily identify a customer, we recommend using a friendly username such as an email for example. The username must be unique (this acts as an identifier to reference and lookup a given merchant on your platform).

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all users
get.description: Returns a list of all users created in your Embedded account.

parameters.name: parentWorkflowId
parameters.description: You can pass a parentWorkflowId if you wish to list users for a specific workflow.

post.description: Use this endpoint to add a credential programmatically via the API. This endpoint should be used primarily for non-OAuth blocks. If you are using Secrets Manager with an OAuth block and you have the OAuth tokens already, you can add them to Alloy with this endpoint. Please reference [this](https://docs.runalloy.com/docs/headless) section of our docs for a complete tutorial on when and how to use this endpoint.

credential.description: The data for the credential you want to create.

userId.description: The id of the currently logged in user

get.description:
This endpoint returns a basic structure of what data must be inputted when adding a credential manually. This should be used when creating a credential using the POST credential endpoint.

This endpoint returns the structure of every supported block on Alloy Embedded. It returns a boolean flag called `isOauth` which indicates if the credential uses OAuth or an API key.

get.summary: Generate a new JWT for a user
get.description: This endpoint is used to generate a new user token in the form of a JSON Web Token (JWT) which is required to securely render the Embedded Modal in your application. Once retrieved, you'll want to pass this token to your frontend.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want to lookup. Returned from the Create User endpoint. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

get.summary: Retrieve all credentials for a user
get.description: Returns a list of all credentials created for a specified user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The id of the currently logged in user

get.description:
Returns a list of all active **parent** workflows associated with your Alloy Embedded account. Note this endpoint does _not_ return a list of workflows that the user has installed, but rather a list of all _available_ workflows. The `installed` flag indicates if the user has installed a copy of the workflow but does not  indicate if the user has a given workflow "active".

For each workflow, this endpoint returns the individual apps that are required as part of the workflow. Commonly used to populate data on an integrations page.

parameters.name: integration
parameters.description: This parameter allows you to filter workflows based on the name of the integration you're looking for. For example, if you were looking for a Shopify integration, specify shopify

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want to lookup. Returned from the Create User endpoint. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

put.description:
Disables all future invocations and runs for a given workflow. 

By deactivating a workflow, this endpoint will turn off any events or webhooks a workflow is subscribed to. May be reactivated by the Reactivate workflow endpoint.

userId.description: The Id of the user you want to lookup. Returned from the Create User endpoint. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

workflowId.description: The Id of the workflow to activate. If you pass this parameter, then `workflowName` is not required.

workflowName.description: The name of the workflow to activate.  If you pass this parameter, then `workflowId` is not required.

put.description: Reactivates a workflow that was previously disabled by the Disable Workflow endpoint. This endpoint requires a specified WorkflowId and returns a success/failure.

userId.description: The Id of the user you want to lookup. Returned from the Create User endpoint. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

workflowName.description: The name of the workflow to activate.  If you pass this parameter, then `workflowId` is not required.

workflowId.description: The Id of the workflow to activate. If you pass this parameter, then `workflowName` is not required.

get.summary: Retrieve usage metrics for a workflow
get.description: This endpoint returns the `totalAppActions` (the number of times each block inside the workflow has been executed over the course of the workflow's lifetime), the `totalWorkflowRuns` (which represents the number of times the workflow has been invoked) and the `totalErrors` (the number of times the workflow has had an error).

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The Id of the workflow you want to find errors for

put.description:
Deactivates all active workflows for a user in bulk. 

This endpoint may be used to perform a bulk operation such as temporarily disabling a user's account in lieu of deleting the user account if the user wants to "pause" their account.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want to lookup. Returned from the Create User endpoint

get.summary: Retrieve all execution logs for a workflow
get.description:
Retrieves log data for a given workflow over time. Logs are stored for a maximum of 60 days before being purged.

Each log includes the `executionId` (which can be used to rerun an execution), the `startedAt` and `stoppedAt` date stamps, and the JSON output of the execution.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The Id of the workflow you want to find logs for

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want delete logs for. Returned from the Create User endpoint

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: page of results

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results per page (max 30, default 10)

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: asc or desc for ascending/descending (default desc)

get.summary: Retrieve all error logs for a workflow
get.description:
This endpoint fetches an array of errors for a specific workflow.

It returns the error message, and the date stamp when the error was thrown, the block that caused the error, and the `workflowId` . Commonly used to debug workflows when they error and identify historical errors; this endpoint may be used in conjunction with the route error messages feature.

If there are no errors for the specified workflow, this endpoint will return an empty array.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The Id of the workflow you want to find errors for

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want delete logs for. Returned from the Create User endpoint

delete.summary: Delete all logs for a user
delete.description:
This endpoint deletes all historical logs associated with a user and is most commonly used in conjunction with a compliance request such as GDPR. This endpoint requires a userId. 

Note that this action cannot be undone.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want delete logs for. Returned from the Create User endpoint

delete.summary: Delete a Credential for a user
delete.description: To delete a credential via the API, you need to invoke the below endpoint.

parameters.name: credentialId
parameters.description: The credential you're looking to delete

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user associated with this credential

post.summary: Trigger an event for a user
post.description:
This endpoint runs a workflow that uses a **Custom Event **. Note that this endpoint cannot be used to invoke a workflow that has a Custom Webhook Trigger.

If you have defined a custom JSON body for the Custom Event, it should be passed into the `data` body parameter.

event.description: The name of the custom event to run.

userId.description: The user Id the workflow belongs to

data.description: The key-value pairs you want to send as defined in the custom event. This data will be used in expressions during the workflow execution.

post.description:
Retrieves log data for a given workflow over time. Logs are stored for a maximum of 60 days before being purged.

Each log includes the `executionId` (which can be used to rerun an execution), the `startedAt` and `stoppedAt` date stamps, and the JSON output of the execution.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The Id of the workflow you want to find logs for

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: The Id of the execution to rerun. This can be retrieved from the GET Workflow Logs endpoint

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want delete logs for. Returned from the Create User endpoint

post.description: This endpoint runs a workflow that uses a **Webhook Trigger.** Note that this endpoint should not be used to invoke a workflow that has a Custom Event. If you have defined a custom JSON body for the webhook trigger, it should be passed into the `data` body parameter.

workflowName.description: The name of the workflow to run.

workflowId.description: The Id of the workflow to activate. If you pass this parameter, then `workflowName` is not required.

userId.description: The Id of the user you want to lookup. Returned from the Create User endpoint. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

data.description: The key-value pairs you want to send as defined in the webhook trigger. This data will be used in expressions during the workflow execution.

get.description: Returns all the available apps currently supported by Alloy Embedded

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all integrations
get.description: Returns all the available integrations in your Alloy Embedded Account. Includes integrations/apps you've created an "integration" for, their workflows and statuses. If `installed` equals `true`, the `installedVersion` key will show the currently installed version.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id used to identify the user. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

post.description: Creates a new user in your Embedded account. The user record acts like a "container" to store all the integrations, workflows, and credentials for any given user. Returns a user identifier.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your Embedded API key for authorization

users.description: An array of `username` and `fullName` to be created.  Note that `username` is mandatory but `fullName` is optional. Limited to 1000 users at a time.
users.default: [{ 	username: 'user123', 	fullName: 'Joe Smoe' }, { 	username: 'user456' }, { 	username: 'janedoe', 	fullName: 'Jane Doe' }]

get.summary: Retrieve a list of custom events
get.description: Returns a list of all Custom Events you have enabled in Alloy Embedded.

description.example: This event is invoked every time a customer is created in your app

get.summary: Create an Embedded link for an integration
get.description: This endpoint generates an alloy Link. For more details on Embedded Link, please [read](https://docs.runalloy.com/docs/alloy-link) this tutorial.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user to generate the Embedded Link for

parameters.name: integrationId
parameters.description: The Id of the integration you want to generate the Embedded Link for

get.description:
This endpoint can be used to generate an OAuth link if you want to completely white label your authentication experience. You can use this endpoint to generate a link which your users can click to redirect to the specified application without rendering the Alloy Embedded Modal.

Note: this endpoint **only** works with OAuth enabled integrations. To add a credential manually, please use the [POST Create Credential API](https://docs.runalloy.com/v2.1/reference/create-a-credential).

This endpoint takes a `userId`, `integrationId`, and `credentialName` as inputs. It should be used in conjunction with the [GET Credential Metadata API](https://docs.runalloy.com/v2.1/reference/get-credential-metadata). `credentialName` represents the name of the integration you want to call.

If the credential metadata endpoint returns any `properties,` you must pass them as query string parameters at the end of this call.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The id of the user to generate this link for

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: The name of the app you want the user to authorize access to

delete.description: Deletes a workflow for a specific user. This endpoint does not delete a workflow for all users.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want to lookup. Returned from the Create User endpoint. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The Id of the workflow to delete

get.description: Find a workflow given a workflowId

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want to lookup. Returned from the Create User endpoint. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The Id of the workflow to find

get.description: Finds a specific integration for a user

parameters.name: integrationId
parameters.description: This API parameter allows you to filter results based on the integrationId or the integrationName (also referred to as 'app'). The integration name (app) is a custom name that you have set for your integration. When using the integration name (app), provide the name of the integration you want to filter for (e.g. 'shopify order sync' or 'magento product creation'). You can obtain the integration name (app) from the List Integrations endpoint under the 'app' parameter, or by checking your UI. Either integrationId or integrationName must be provided but it cannot be both.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id used to identify the user. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The Id of the parent workflow you would like to list users for.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you would like to query.

put.description:
This endpoint allows you as the ISV to upgrade the workflow for a specified end user.

In order to upgrade a workflow via this endpoint, the new workflow must have the same configurable fields as the original. If any new configurable fields were added, you will not be able to upgrade the workflow programmatically and instead would need to reinstall the workflow for the end user.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: Id of the parent workflow in which you are upgrading for the end user

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Id of the end user you wish to upgrade the workflow for

get.summary: Retrieve a list of workflow versions
get.description: Returns a list of all versions available for a given workflow

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user you want to lookup. Returned from the Create User endpoint. Note: you can also use the Embedded user's `username` in this field.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The Id of the workflow you want to retrieve versions for

get.summary: Retrieve credential structure for an app

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: Name of App (camelCased, can be found in App Metadata response)

description.example: Enter your store subdomain. If your store domain is example.myshopify.com, the subdomain would be example.

post.description: This endpoint will create an installation record and return the information required to create a form for your user to fill out.

userId.description: ID of the user that will install your integration

integrationId.description: ID of the integration which is being installed

credentialIds.description: List of credentials to be used in this installation. If the user has authorized any of the apps in the integration more than once, then this field is required. Otherwise, the user's credentials will be automatically detected.

workflowIds.description: A list of workflows to include in this installation, if only a subset is desired. If every workflow in the integration will be installed, this field is optional.

Result.value: {"message":"User is not authorized to install integrations for this account"}

message.example: User is not authorized to install integrations for this account

installationId.description: ID you received when you started the installation.

data.description: Values filled by user in your installation form
